title: Cathay Pacific Puts Dollar Bond Sale on Ice After Cool Reception From Investors
text:
Hong Kong’s flagship carrier Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd. shelved plans to sell its first U.S. dollar bonds in more than two decades after receiving lukewarm interest from potential investors, according to people familiar with the matter.

The airline has struggled with steep declines in passenger numbers in recent months and was embroiled in controversy after some of its employees took part in antigovernment protests in Hong Kong. Those actions drew criticism from Chinese authorities and threats to boycott its flights from...
